Dear Mr. Ziomkowski:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
September 8, 2021 and September 9, 2021. Due to the violations of applicable licensing
rules, sections of the contract and MISEP requirements, a written corrective action plan
is required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of
the MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of
this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Jessica VandenHeuvel, Area Manager, at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.155 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; initial treatment plan.
(1) The social service worker shall complete, sign, and date
an initial treatment plan for each resident within 30
calendar days of admission.
Two of six initial treatment plans reviewed were completed more than 30 calendar
days from admission. One initial treatment plan was one day late. One initial
treatment plan did not use the date of admission to complete the report within 30
calendar days.
R 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff
qualifications.
(1) Child caring institutions subject to 42 USC 671 shall not
permit a child caring institution staff member to begin
working unless all of the following has been completed
using the forms, and in the manner, prescribed by the
department:
(a) A criminal record check as referenced in R
400.4113(f), including a fingerprint-based check of national
crime information databases, unless an alternative criminal
history check has been approved by the federal
government.
(b) A check of Michigan's child abuse and neglect
central registry or Canadian provincial agency as
referenced in R 400.4113(i). (c) A check of other states'
child abuse registry where the person has lived in within
the preceding five years.
Five of nine new employee files reviewed did not complete a criminal records check
prior to the employee beginning work.
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and shall include documentation of all of the following
information prior to employment or at the time specified in this
rule:
1

(j) A written evaluation of the employee's performance within
30 days of the completion of the probationary period or within
180 days, whichever is less, and a written evaluation of the
employee’s performance annually thereafter.
One of twelve employee records reviewed did not have a performance evaluation
completed.
R 400.4139 Driver's License
The institution shall document that the driver of any vehicle
transporting residents at the request of or on behalf of the
licensee shall be an adult and possess a valid operator or
chauffeur license with endorsement appropriate to the vehicle
driven and the circumstances of its use.
Three of twelve employee records reviewed had expired driver’s licenses.
R 400.4156 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; updated treatment plan.
(1) The social service worker shall complete, sign, and date an
updated treatment plan for each resident at least once every 90-
calendar days following the initial treatment plan.
One of six resident files reviewed did not complete an updated treatment plan every
90-calendar days. One updated treatment plan was one day late.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance with all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract/Policy violation. Please note
that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included
in section 1. The facility is in compliance with all additional DHHS Contract/Policy
requirements.

The facility was not in need of any consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this
licensing period.
The facility has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period. The CAP was in response to the 2020
Renewal Inspection Report. The CAP was appropriate and approved. There were no
repeat rule violations during this inspection.
During the period under review there have been nine special investigations. Eight
investigations resulted in the facility being found in full compliance. One investigation
resulted in the facility being found in non-compliance, requiring a corrective action
plan. The non-compliance included staff-to-resident ratio and staff qualifications.
During quarterly unannounced visits and corrective action plan compliance reviews,
the agency has successfully implemented all aspects of their corrective action plans.
The staff that were interviewed were very positive about their jobs. They reported
feeling supported, heard by administration, and having the necessary tools to do their
work with the youth. The youth that were interviewed spoke highly of staff, knowing
the expectations of the program and having someone on staff to talk with if needed.
The facility was clean, neat, and organized. A virtual walk through was completed for
TLC due to positive Covid cases.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
3

Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility
continue on their regular license.
